It is my understanding that twentyforty doesn't do music concerts as his conversion technique isn't kind to multiple heads in crowds.  Makes them all turn to mush, as it were.

But if you ARE ever tempted to do some, I put my vote in for Within Temptation's Black Symphony performance as a 352P for iPods etc.
As well as Pink Floyd.
Oh well, we can only live in hope :)

@formerly_azrielle : Concerts are fine if file-size doesn't matter
 or if they are available - I searched few months ago when you've mentioned WT's Black Symphony but I couldn't find BluRay available for download (and in reasonable manner). (still seeded by me - good and fast)
and first Hit-man torrent is probably dead by now. I still remember my encoding of Last Waltz for my late friend lilars (Bob) some six moths ago.

That's all - and quite few uploaders are specialized in/for music videos - not me.

@gopesk: No, I cannot, there is no HiDef source, never was and never be... out there float few DVDrips. Do plain Google download and fire-up jdownloader.

@gopesk: Keep in mind that you search for something and can find a shit...  and I found your title on Google in five minutes - even on three different places. DVDrip - all three. 

1st. If I am in your shoes - I would be lucky to find anything.
2nd. Never ever look for rare things on torrent sites - logic implies that if some title is old and not very well known - out there is not many who would seed year or two, even longer.
3. Great downloads and some forgotten but great movies are on numerous file-hosting sites. Use torrents when suits better - but do not restrict yourself.
